<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Send user heartbeat"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/users/heartbeat"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Records a heartbeat for the authenticated user session to mark the user as online. The platform derives the client type from the authenticated user context (for example, `Web` or `Mobile` based on the `Client` header).

**Workflow Example**
1. Client sends periodic heartbeats (for example, every 60 seconds) using [POST /api/v1.0/users/heartbeat](/docs/api/users/send-user-heartbeat).
2. Presence is updated and can be queried via [GET /api/v1.0/users/is-online/\{Source\}/\{UserId\}](#/Users/isUserOnlineLegacy).
3. If heartbeats stop, maintenance routines may mark the user offline.

**Minimal Required Fields**: None. Optional headers: `Client`, `ProductId`.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

  parameters={[{"name":"ProductId","in":"header","required":false,"description":"Optional product context used when deriving presence scope.","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"example":"88df910c-91aa-e711-80c2-0004ffa00010"},{"name":"Client","in":"header","required":false,"description":"Client identifier used to infer the requesting platform (for example `WebBrowser` or `Mobile`).","schema":{"type":"string"},"example":"WebBrowser"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
